graph

Class ExplicitGraph<T extends Node>

  • java.lang.Object
    • graph.ExplicitGraph<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Graph<T,BiDirectionalEdge<T>>, NeighborProvider<T,BiDirectionalEdge<T>>

    public class ExplicitGraph<T extends Node>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Graph<T,BiDirectionalEdge<T>>, NeighborProvider<T,BiDirectionalEdge<T>>
    This graph is explicit in the sense that it has an explicit set of both nodes and edges. This is the more intuitive approach, but it will not work very good.
    Author:
    Stijn
    See Also:
    LinkedGraph, DynamicGraph

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ExplicitGraph() 
      ExplicitGraph(java.util.Set<T> nodes, java.util.Set<BiDirectionalEdge<T>> edges)
      Initializes the graph with all its nodes and edges already provided.

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addEdge(BiDirectionalEdge<T> edge)

      void addNode(T node) 
      void addNodes(java.util.Collection<T> nodes) 
      boolean containsNode(T node)
      Returns true if the graph contains given node.
      double getCostBetween(T node0, T node1)
      Returns the cost between the given nodes, if the graph is directed, it returns the cost from node0 to node1.
      java.util.Set<BiDirectionalEdge<T>> getEdgesFrom(T node)
      Returns a set of one way edges to all the neighbors of the given node, it encapsulates both the neighbor and the cost, so no need for two separate methods.
      java.util.Set<T> getNeighborsOf(T node)
      Returns the neighbors to the given node.
      java.util.Set<T> getNodes()

      • addEdges

        public void addEdges(T node,
            java.util.List<T> neighbours,
            double[][] costs)
        Parameters:
        node - The one node which has the other nodes as neighbours
        neighbours - Those neighbours
        costs - a neighbours.size()x2 matrix, so that costs[0][0] is the cost from the node to the first neighbour, and costs[0][1] is the cost of the first neighbour to the node.

      • getCostBetween

        public double getCostBetween(T node0,
                    T node1)
        Description copied from interface: Graph
        Returns the cost between the given nodes, if the graph is directed, it returns the cost from node0 to node1. If not reachable, returns Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
        Specified by:
        getCostBetween in interface Graph<T extends Node,BiDirectionalEdge<T extends Node>>
